what: Compute summary based on both boostrapped samples and of posterior predictive distribution — compute_bootstrap_and_posterior_predictions
title: Compute summary based on both boostrapped samples and of posterior predictive distribution — compute_bootstrap_and_posterior_predictions
text: Computes bootstrapped summary via bootstrap_response_counts() posterior predictions via posterior_predictions_for_response_counts(), joins fixed factors response variable specified formula

title: Compute summary based on both boostrapped samples and of posterior predictive distribution — compute_bootstrap_and_posterior_predictions
code: compute_bootstrap_and_posterior_predictions(   df,   formula,   eta,   cutpoints,   ci_variable = "P",   RBoot = 2000,   RPost = NULL,   CI = 0.97,   .progress = TRUE )

title: Compute summary based on both boostrapped samples and of posterior predictive distribution — compute_bootstrap_and_posterior_predictions
text: df Table data formula Formula specifies outcome variable, fixed random effects. eta Matrix samples_n x nrow(df), row single posterior sample cutpoints Matrix samples_n x nlevels(df$outcome) - 1, row single posterior sample ci_variable variable use percentile confidence intervals, either "N" "P" (default). RBoot Number samples bootstrapping, default 2000. RPost Number posterior samples process, NULL (default) means samples used. CI Percentile confidence interval, default 0.97 .progress Logical, whether show progress bar bootstrapping. Default TRUE.

title: Compute summary based on both boostrapped samples and of posterior predictive distribution — compute_bootstrap_and_posterior_predictions
text: data.frame tibble fixed effects columns, PosteriorMean, PosteriorMedian, PosteriorLowerCI, PosteriorUpperCI.

title: Compute summary based on both boostrapped samples and of posterior predictive distribution — compute_bootstrap_and_posterior_predictions
code: data(aiq) data(aiq_draws) eta_draws <- extract_stan_posterior_matrix(aiq_draws, eta) cutpoints_draws <- extract_stan_posterior_matrix(aiq_draws, cutpoints) aiq_avg <-   compute_bootstrap_and_posterior_predictions(aiq,                                               Response ~ Group + Question,                                               eta_draws,                                               cutpoints_draws,                                               RBoot=10,                                               RPost=10)

what: Compute total count and proportion responses for each level per combination of factors — count_responses
title: Compute total count and proportion responses for each level per combination of factors — count_responses
text: Compute total count proportion responses level per combination factors defined formula: <response_var> ~ <fixed_factor1> +  <fixed_factor2> + ... (1|<random_factor1>) + (1|<random_factor2>) + .... <response_var> must factor, function fills missing response level counts zeros.

title: Compute total count and proportion responses for each level per combination of factors — count_responses
code: count_responses(df, formula, resample = FALSE, predictions = NULL)

title: Compute total count and proportion responses for each level per combination of factors — count_responses
text: df Table data formula Formula specifies outcome variable, fixed random effects. resample logical formula. resample = TRUE : resampled replacement entire table. resample = ~ <var1> + <var2> + ... resample grouped data. predictions vector NULL. Optional values replace original response values. Useful applying counting procedure model predictions.

title: Compute total count and proportion responses for each level per combination of factors — count_responses
text: tibble columns fixed factors response variable, well columns N (total count) P (proportion responses level).

title: Compute total count and proportion responses for each level per combination of factors — count_responses
text: data first grouped fixed random factors responses counted per factor level. missing combinations filled zero counts. Next, function computes proportion response level fixed random factors combinations. Finally, groups data fixed factors compute total counts averagere proportion responses per factor level. Optionally, data can resampled replacement counting. resample entire table set resample = TRUE. Alternatively, can resample within data group using formula: resample = ~ <var1> + <var2> + .... , data first grouped resampled.

title: Compute total count and proportion responses for each level per combination of factors — count_responses
code: data(art)  counts <- count_responses(art, Response ~ Group + PaintingKind + Scale)  # with resampling over entire table count_sample <- count_responses(art, Response ~ Group + PaintingKind + Scale, resample = TRUE)  # with resampling per group count_sample <- count_responses(art, Response ~ Group + PaintingKind + Scale, resample = ~ Group)

title: Parse formula into outcome, fixed, and random effects — parse_formula
code: # only one fixed effect parse_formula(y ~ x) #> $outcome #> [1] "y" #>  #> $fixed #> [1] "x" #>  #> $random #> NULL #>  #> $all #> [1] "x" "y" #>   # two fixed effects parse_formula(y ~ x1 + x2) #> $outcome #> [1] "y" #>  #> $fixed #> [1] "x1" "x2" #>  #> $random #> NULL #>  #> $all #> [1] "x1" "x2" "y"  #>   # one random effect parse_formula(y ~ (1|z)) #> $outcome #> [1] "y" #>  #> $fixed #> character(0) #>  #> $random #> [1] "z" #>  #> $all #> [1] "z" "y" #>   # one fixed and two random effects parse_formula(y ~ x + (1|z1) + (1|z2)) #> $outcome #> [1] "y" #>  #> $fixed #> [1] "x" #>  #> $random #> [1] "z1" "z2" #>  #> $all #> [1] "x"  "z1" "z2" "y"  #>

title: Parse Stan array parameter — parse_stan_posterior_array
text: draws cmdstanr draws "df" format varname Name variable draws columns List columns correspond array indexes. columns described via <name> = <vector factor levels>. index converted factor column labelled factor levels. <vector factor levels> NULL, column contains original integer indexes. value_name Name value column, defaults "Value"

title: Plot estimated intensity as box plots — plot_intensity
text: df Table estimated response intensity intensity Variable estimated response intensity cutpoints Vector estimated cut points group Variable grouping data NULL single estimate fill_interval Fill colors stripes indicate intervals. x_labels_pos Either "bottom" (default) "top". latter useful combined plots.

title: Plot estimated intensity as box plots — plot_intensity
code: data("aiq") data("aiq_draws")  # extract estimated intensity intensity_df <- parse_stan_posterior_array(aiq_draws, a, list("Group" = levels(aiq$Group))) intensity_df[["Intensity"]] <- inv_logit(intensity_df[["Value"]])  # extract cutpoints cutpoints <- inv_logit(colMeans(extract_stan_posterior_matrix(aiq_draws, cutpoints))) plot_intensity(intensity_df, Intensity, cutpoints, group = Group)   # ignoring grouping plot_intensity(intensity_df, Intensity, cutpoints)

title: Plot proportion or count of responses — plot_responses
text: df Table data x Name response level variable y Name variable statistic, either proportion P counts N ymin Name variable lower limit error bar, e.g., LowerCI. Optional. ymax Name variable lower limit error bar, e.g., UpperCI. Optional. ribbon_ymin Name variable lower limit ribbon, e.g., PosteriorLowerCI. Optional. ribbon_ymax Name variable upper limit ribbon, e.g., PosteriorUpperCI. Optional. color Name variable maps color. Optional. group Name variable maps grouping. Optional. cutpoints Optional vector estimated cut points. case matrix, average computed per column fill_interval Fill colors stripes indicate intervals.

title: Plot proportion or count of responses — plot_responses
text: ggplot

title: Plot proportion or count of responses — plot_responses
code: data(aiq) aiq_avg <- bootstrap_response_counts(aiq, Response ~ Group + Question, R = 100) #>  ■■■■■■■■■                         27% |  ETA:  8s #>  ■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■                 53% |  ETA:  5s #>  ■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■         79% |  ETA:  2s aiq_q1 <- dplyr::filter(aiq_avg, Question == Question[1]) plot_responses(aiq_q1, x = Response, y = P, color = Group)  #>            x      xend PANEL group alpha   fill #> 1 0.03703704 0.1693122     1    -1     1 gray90 #> 2 0.16931217 0.3015873     1    -1     1 gray85 #> 3 0.30158730 0.4338624     1    -1     1 gray90 #> 4 0.43386243 0.5661376     1    -1     1 gray85 #> 5 0.56613757 0.6984127     1    -1     1 gray90 #> 6 0.69841270 0.8306878     1    -1     1 gray85 #> 7 0.83068783 0.9629630     1    -1     1 gray90  # with errorbars plot_responses(aiq_q1, x = Response, y = P, ymin = LowerCI, ymax = UpperCI, color = Group)  #>            x      xend PANEL group alpha   fill #> 1 0.03703704 0.1693122     1    -1     1 gray90 #> 2 0.16931217 0.3015873     1    -1     1 gray85 #> 3 0.30158730 0.4338624     1    -1     1 gray90 #> 4 0.43386243 0.5661376     1    -1     1 gray85 #> 5 0.56613757 0.6984127     1    -1     1 gray90 #> 6 0.69841270 0.8306878     1    -1     1 gray85 #> 7 0.83068783 0.9629630     1    -1     1 gray90  # with ribbon intead of error bars plot_responses(aiq_q1, x = Response, y = P,                ribbon_ymin = LowerCI, ribbon_ymax = UpperCI, color = Group)  #>            x      xend PANEL group alpha   fill #> 1 0.03703704 0.1693122     1    -1     1 gray90 #> 2 0.16931217 0.3015873     1    -1     1 gray85 #> 3 0.30158730 0.4338624     1    -1     1 gray90 #> 4 0.43386243 0.5661376     1    -1     1 gray85 #> 5 0.56613757 0.6984127     1    -1     1 gray90 #> 6 0.69841270 0.8306878     1    -1     1 gray85 #> 7 0.83068783 0.9629630     1    -1     1 gray90  # with cutpoints from the model fit data(aiq_draws) cutpoints_draws <- extract_stan_posterior_matrix(aiq_draws, cutpoints) plot_responses(aiq_q1, x = Response, y = P, ymin = LowerCI, ymax = UpperCI,                color = Group, cutpoints = inv_logit(colMeans(cutpoints_draws)))  #>            x       xend PANEL group alpha   fill #> 1 0.03703704 0.04360385     1    -1     1 gray90 #> 2 0.04360385 0.09866389     1    -1     1 gray85 #> 3 0.09866389 0.33707025     1    -1     1 gray90 #> 4 0.33707025 0.61361725     1    -1     1 gray85 #> 5 0.61361725 0.92193144     1    -1     1 gray90 #> 6 0.92193144 0.96101913     1    -1     1 gray85 #> 7 0.96101913 0.96296296     1    -1     1 gray90

title: Compute summary of posterior predictive distribution for the data given posterior distributions of eta and cutpoints — posterior_predictions_for_response_counts
text: df Table data formula Formula specifies outcome variable, fixed random effects. eta Matrix samples_n x nrow(df), row single posterior sample cutpoints Matrix samples_n x nlevels(df$outcome) - 1, row single posterior sample ci_variable variable use percentile confidence intervals, either "N" "P" (default). R Number samples process, NULL (default) means samples used. CI Percentile confidence interval, default 0.97 .progress Logical, whether show progress bar bootstrapping. Default TRUE.
